review_title: For the most part very good

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Myers, FL

job_title: Staff RN in Port Charlotte, FL
pros: teamwork is strong with full time staff. Probably the best pay in the area. Benefits are decent, everyone's insurances plans are terrible, so that's a moot point. Hospital is expanding.
cons: Lots of micro managing on dayshifts, Night shifts are pretty much left to fend for their own. High turnover rates, often shifts are staffed by travelers and agency who are often either way over qualified or under.

review_title: Fawcett is like a second family!
job_title: Charge Nurse in Port Charlotte, FL
pros: I have been at Fawcett for many years now, and I can't imagine working any place else. Our unit is so supportive of eathother. We have team building nights regularly that are a lot of fun. Our leadership team loves to celebrate successes and we get to do that often. I love where I work!
cons: None - it's a great place to work!

job_title: Nurse Manager in Port Charlotte, FL
pros: A great team to work with both at bedside and in management and administration.  I am "homegrown" and have moved up through the ranks and intend to continue to advance my career.
cons: The facility needs to expand.

job_title: Interventional Radiology RN in Port Charlotte, FL
pros: Good pay and benefits, great team to work with, great Radiologists
cons: Too much heavy lifting of patients and pushing stretchers and beds. No opportunity for advancement. No pertinent CEUs for licensure renewal on state mandatory education. Too many hours on call, interference with off time life.
